DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study demonstrate superiority percutaneous posterior tibial nerve stimulation ( PTNS ) therapy compare sham therapy treatment patient overall bladder ( OAB ) symptom .
DOC.brief_title: Study Urgent PC Versus Sham Effectiveness Treatment Overactive Bladder Symptoms
DOC.criteria: Women men > 18 year age A score > 4 OABq short form urgency ( question 1 ) Average urinary frequency > 10 time one 24 hour day base 3day void diary Selfreported bladder symptom present > 3 month Selfreported fail conservative care ( i.e. , dietary restriction , fluid restriction , bladder training , behavioral modification , pelvic muscle training , biofeedback , etc . ) Off antimuscarinics least 2 week prior enrollment Capable give informed consent Ambulatory able use toilet independently , without difficulty Capable willing follow studyrelated procedure Pregnant confirm urine pregnancy test , plan become pregnant study period Neurogenic bladder Botox use bladder pelvic floor muscle past year Pacemakers implantable defibrillator Primary complaint stress urinary incontinence Current urinary tract infection ( UTI ) Current vaginal infection Current use InterStim Current use Bion Current use TENS pelvic region , back legs Previously treat PTNS Use investigational drug/device therapy within past 4 week Participating participate within past 4 week clinical investigation involve impact gynecologic , urinary renal function Deemed unsuitable enrollment study investigator base subject ' history physical examination ( include bleed disorder anticoagulant medication , peripheral neuropathy ) Subjects nerve damage would impact either percutaneous tibial nerve pelvic floor function
